alert.note: Alert for Mohave (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 21 at 1:33AM MST until August 21 at 3:15AM MST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 AM MST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected over the Aquarius Mountains east of Wikieup. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Arizona, including the following county, Mohave. * WHEN...Until 445 AM MST. * IMPACTS...Rises in small streams and normally dry washes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 131 AM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.25 and 0.5 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Natural Corrals Wash, Bitter Creek, Bull Canyon, Adobe Creek, Kaiser Spring Canyon, Tule Wash, Francis Creek, Gray Wash, West Fork Sycamore Creek, Salt Creek, Sycamore Creek, Burro Creek, Box Canyon Wash, Ash Creek, Bronco Creek and Big Sandy River. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Southeast Mohave County - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
